content: You are not able to do this in <5 mins

Why are the empty squares denoted by a 'X' and not a dot '.' as in any other puzzle of this kind?!
Why isn't the rover denoted by a < > ^ v to indicate the direction it is facing initially?
Is the '#' really necessary (no) or just confusing (yes)? (Why not activate the breaks to stop in the middle of each "F R" then?)

These are general design remarks, but the amount of poor arbitrary choices that one has to guess in reverse mode is particularly concerning.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good idea, not too easy, and doable in reverse even if the A is difficult to find in the some maps (too similar with X ) .

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting problem. I think it fits to the CoC format. The description is clear and it is not very difficult. Great job !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice problem, interesting, not sure I'd win any awards for shortest though (about 700 characters in Dart). But if you know what you're doing, can probably be done in under 5 minutes.

I like the puzzle, interesting question but not too hard to solve. I guess it could work for reverse but I don't like it there as much as shortest or fastest. 

That said, if you're going to submit it for a "fastest" clash, that's a fairly long description to read through before coding. My two cents.
Hi, I'd love to get feedback on this short puzzle that I came up with for Clash of Code, any feedback at all is welcome.
I abbreviated the statement. Thanks for the feedback!
You're right, I'll work on changing the puzzle to make it more accessible for reverse mode.
